page.title: 09 NEWMINSTER ABBEY
page.content: Newminster Abbey, built circa{1137} to{1138}was closed in{1537}by{Henry {VIII.}The Abbey though small in importance and power was the largest in the county covering an area of{ {26.6 acres.}It is not known exactly how much land the monks owned because people bequeathed land to the Abbey from all over Morpeth. At first the Abbey housed twelve monks but the numbers fluctuated over the years.These{Roman Catholic}monks farmed and generally worked very hard.They were not particularly strict but were well disciplined and punished for sins. Newminster was a daughter abbey of{ {Fountains}in Yorkshire and had two daughters of its own, Pipewell and Roche, both in Yorkshire.Newminster Abbey was last used in 1937 for the 400th anniversary of its closing.
